## Information Needs
I can see that the Workload Identity Pool was created successfully, but no provider exists yet. We need to create the provider before proceeding.

## Technical Direction
Now that we've confirmed the pool exists but the provider doesn't, let's create the provider using the Google Cloud Console approach. The command line has been giving errors, but the web console should work more reliably for this step.

## Action Items - Ready for Execution

### 1. Create the Provider using Google Cloud Console:

1. Go to the Google Cloud Console: https://console.cloud.google.com/
2. Navigate to "IAM & Admin" > "Workload Identity Federation"
3. Click on the "github-actions-pool" pool
4. Click "ADD PROVIDER"
5. Select "OpenID Connect (OIDC)"
6. Enter the following details:
   - Provider name: `github-provider`
   - Provider ID: `github-provider` (should auto-fill)
   - Issuer URL: `https://token.actions.githubusercontent.com`
7. Under "Allowed audiences", add: `https://iam.googleapis.com/projects/711898853198/locations/global/workloadIdentityPools/github-actions-pool/providers/github-provider`
8. Click "CONTINUE"
9. Under "Configure provider attributes":
   - For Attribute mapping, add:
     - `google.subject` = `assertion.sub`
   - Set Attribute condition to: `attribute.repository=="palios-taey/palios-taey-nova"`
10. Click "SAVE"

### 2. After creating the provider, run these commands:

```bash
# Verify the provider was created
gcloud iam workload-identity-pools providers describe "github-provider" \
  --project="ai-execution-system" \
  --location="global" \
  --workload-identity-pool="github-actions-pool" \
  --format="value(name)"

# Configure the service account binding
gcloud iam service-accounts add-iam-policy-binding "github-actions-sa@ai-execution-system.iam.gserviceaccount.com" \
  --project="ai-execution-system" \
  --role="roles/iam.workloadIdentityUser" \
  --member="principalSet://iam.googleapis.com/projects/711898853198/locations/global/workloadIdentityPools/github-actions-pool/attribute.repository=palios-taey/palios-taey-nova"
```

Once you've created the provider through the console and confirmed it exists with the command above, I'll prepare the GitHub Actions workflow file that uses this authentication method.
